events.name: Harnessing the Power of Data Analytics Across the Organisation... @ BDIS 2017
events.description: This session is part of Big Data & Analytics Innovation Summit 2017, a 2 day event hosted by Innovation Enterprise. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Leverage Big Data To Maximize Business Performance" Why Attend? Learn how to organize your data science team and tools so you can increase productivity whilst democratising the knowledge produced.  For those at the start of the data journey, learn how to construct an effective data strategy from the ground up so your organization never falls behind the curve. Enjoy pro-active and organized networking opportunities to build new business relationships and opportunities inspired by others in your field. Get to grips with the world’s latest and most advanced data tools and technologies to optimize your testing phase. And benchmark your organization’s data initiatives against your competitors and across different industries. More information here:  https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/big-data-singapore-2017 Agenda: Wednesday, March 1 09:00 - Harnessing the Power of Data Analytics Across the Organisation by David Gledhill — Group CIO at DBS Bank  ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** How to Register: https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/big-data-singapore-2017/registration For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience on Screen: Space Films
events.description:
Dates:
1 – 14 Mar: Achieving the Impossible (with the exclusion of 8 Mar)
3 & 10 Mar: Family Fridays – The Explorers
17 – 19 Mar: ET

Screening Times: Various
Venue: Expression Gallery, Level 4

Free

Explore a wide selection of exciting space adventures! Follow female mathematicians, coders and engineers as they form part of the core team at NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration during the 1960s; explore the wonders of our solar system with Brian Cox and imagine what challenges we would face if we discovered alternative lifeforms in space.

From 1 – 14 March (excluding 8 Mar): Go behind-the-scenes with the screening of Achieving the Impossible, a 22-minute documentary film featuring exclusive footage in the making of Hidden Figures, the Oscar-nominated film that stars Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe. 

During Family Fridays, we revisit a number of classic children sci-fi adventures, and discover what happens when dreams of building your own spacecraft become reality or when a friendly alien comes to live with you.

Free admission. Held in conjunction with NASA - A Human Adventure, which is closing on 19 March.

#NASAartscience #ArtScienceOnScreen

events.name: Building Quality Android Apps
events.description: RSVP at Meetup Page is not sufficient, please register at https://events.withgoogle.com/building-quality-android-apps-march-1st/ Google will host an evening session focussed on App Quality where Regional Developer Advocates and Experts talk about App Stability, Interoperability and User Experience. events.name: StackUp Productivity Workshop: Agility Enacted
events.description:
This interactive workshop provides the foundational knowledge and simulated experience participants within a Scrum team will need to get started. The workshop enables participants to understand their role within the Scrum team structure and equip them with the knowledge, skills, and tools to successfully implement Scrum.
The workshop applies team-based learning to ensure that participants gain practical experience working with the Scrum roles, ceremonies, and artifacts.
Agenda: 

Class Introduction
Introduction to Scrum
Scrum Enacted
Debriefing
Q&A

 Speaker: Sharan Mangalore
Sharan has over 12 years of IT project/product development and process improvement knowledge in technology related projects. He has worked in the telecommunications R&D, financial services, defense and Healthcare industries for numerous companies including Motorola, Agilent Technologies, Thales Security and Allscripts Healthcare IT.
Sharan has utilized Agile principles to drive culture change and improve business and technology processes that have resulted in significant improvements in cost, customer delivery and satisfaction, quality and employee morale.
Sharan has a passion for using Agile and Lean principles to create business value and competitive advantage for companies. However, his greatest excitement is through the coaching and development of team members on their technology process improvement journey, enabling them to initiate and sustain their own improvements and culture change. A key success factor for Sharan is using a servant leadership approach and “respect for every individual” to empower teams.
Reserving a Seat:
Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat. Seats for the general public will be available on 28 Feb 17.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include:  • DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis,  • Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and • Planning sessions for wider community events.  This time, we're ramping up for a DataDive on the weekend of March 24-26! This is a closed, by-invitation only session for volunteers whom we've worked with before. If we've forgotten you (sorry!) or you're new and have a burning desire to join these sessions, please send us a message! For others who can't make it regularly, these sessions are helping us have more community-wide events. Please understand that no food will be provided, so do make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, it would be great if you bring your own water bottle along with your laptop and power cable too. Agenda 6.45 - 7pm: Registration7 - 7.30pm: Data review and task assignment7.30 - 9.30pm: Data cleaning
events.location: #03-04, IDA labs @ National Design Centre,  #03-04, 111 Middle Road, 188969, Singapore

events.name: Woodworking Basics for Adults (Level 1)
events.description:
Mastering the basic woodworking tools is perhaps the most important but often overlooked step towards creating great woodworking projects. With today’s emphasis on speed and instant gratification, many woodworkers have jumped straight into using expensive power tools when using a hand tool could be a much cheaper, quicker and satisfying option.

In this introductory class to the Woodworking Basics for Adults course, we will be taking a skills-based approach to learning woodworking and will be making a beautiful wooden spatula for you to bring home. In support of sustainability, we will be using pine & kapor wood offcuts as our base material.

- Improve your knowledge of wood and learn where to find tools and wood sources in Singapore;
- Use woodworking hand tools (chisels, spokeshaves, hand drills) with precision
- Listen to your inner artist and develop a feel for woodworking
- Make a wooden spatula

Classes begin with a minimum of 3 people (max 6). This introductory class is the starting point to becoming a hobbyist woodworker. The full woodcraft course comprises 4 modules.
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704
